verses.verse: He also prepares for Himself instruments of death; He makes His arrows into fiery shafts.
(Job 15:35; Is. 59:4; (James 1:15)) Behold, the wicked brings forth iniquity; Yes, he conceives trouble and brings forth falsehood.
He made a pit and dug it out, ((Job 4:8); Ps. 57:6) And has fallen into the ditch which he made.
(Esth. 9:25; Ps. 140:9) His trouble shall return upon his own head, And his violent dealing shall come down on his own crown.
I will praise the LORD according to His righteousness, And will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.

(The Glory of the LORD in Creation) To the Chief Musician. On the instrument of Gath. A Psalm of David. [1] O LORD, our Lord, How (Ps. 148:13) excellent is Your name in all the earth, Who have (Ps. 113:4) set Your glory above the heavens!
(Matt. 21:16; (1 Cor. 1:27)) Out of the mouth of babes and nursing infants You have ordained strength, Because of Your enemies, That You may silence (Ps. 44:16) the enemy and the avenger.
When I (Ps. 111:2) consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, The moon and the stars, which You have ordained,
(Job 7:17, 18; (Heb. 2:6-8)) What is man that You are mindful of him, And the son of man that You ((Job 10:12)) visit him?
For You have made him a little lower than the angels, And You have crowned him with glory and honor.
((Gen. 1:26, 28)) You have made him to have dominion over the works of Your hands; ((1 Cor. 15:27; Eph. 1:22; Heb. 2:8)) You have put all things under his feet,
All sheep and oxen— Even the beasts of the field,
The birds of the air, And the fish of the sea That pass through the paths of the seas.
(Ps. 8:1) O LORD, our Lord, How excellent is Your name in all the earth!

(Prayer and Thanksgiving for the LORD’s Righteous Judgments) To the Chief Musician. To the tune of “Death of the Son.” A Psalm of David. [1] I will praise You, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will tell of all Your marvelous works.
I will be glad and (Ps. 5:11; 104:34) rejoice in You; I will sing praise to Your name, ((Ps. 83:18; 92:1)) O Most High.
When my enemies turn back, They shall fall and perish at Your presence.
For You have maintained my right and my cause; You sat on the throne judging in righteousness.
You have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked; You have (Prov. 10:7) blotted out their name forever and ever.
O enemy, destructions are finished forever! And you have destroyed cities; Even their memory has ((Ps. 34:16)) perished.
